greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = number of the row (counting from initial row 1) of the array R in A087465 that contains n.
comment: A sequence that contains itself as a proper subsequence (infinitely many times); that is, a fractal sequence.
link: Clark Kimberling and John E. Brown, Partial Complements and Transposable Dispersions, J. Integer Seqs., Vol. 7, 2004.
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Sep 09 2003
